mdRecord.dcterms:title: Iron-Gate, Alleghany County Virginia, August, 1889 / Dunlap and Kennaday, Engineers
Iron Gate, Alleghany County Virginia, August, 1889
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: A. Hoen & Co.
Dunlap and Kennaday.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Iron Gate Land and Improvement Co.
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 57 x 76 cm. on sheet 60 x 79 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Shows street names, lot and block numbers, manufacturing sites.
Map oriented with north towards lower right.
Note: Iron Gate. The location is one of the healthiest and most beautiful in the South ... For further information address Iron Gate Land and Improvement Co. Iron Gate Virginia.
Small b&w vignette just to right of title: The Gate.

Two map insets: 1. upper left-- untitled locater map (col.) of mid-Atlantic and northeastern USA showing radial distances at 100 mile intervals -- 2. lower center--untitled b&w locater map of vicinity of Iron Gate with radial distances at 5 mile intervals.
Annotated with handwritten notes about the lots acquired by the "Staunton Syndicate."
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Fragile, with several tears.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Iron Gate Land and Improvement Co.--Maps.
